question: The first Carnatic war was ended by signing the treaty of
explanation:
The First Carnatic (1744-48) war was fought between British East India Company and the French East India Company due to Austrian war of succession in Europe. The French forces under Dupleix defeated the English and captured Madras. Then, in 1748 AD, the peace treaty of
Aix-la-Chapelle was signed and Madras was restored to the British and the exchange of war prisoners took place.
